name: VenturePact
overview:
VenturePact is a startup incubator founded at The Wharton School that provides product development and tech resources to its portfolio companies. In other words, they apply a VC model but provide tech help instead of capital. They started VenturePact when while working at other startups, the founders realized that tech talent is scarce and outsourcing is marred by misaligned incentives.

VenturePact started in 2012 and currently has 11 portfolio companies, mostly run by Wharton and Harvard MBA and alumni. The engineering staff is now up to 25 full time employees and they also run a Fellows Program, whereby they connect students to startups for semester, summer and full time positions.

The eventual vision is to essentially become a startup machine; enabling entrepreneurs world over to act on their ideas.
